Title: Literature Research on the Use and Requirements of Datagram Communication and Protocols in AAS and Digital Twins
Venue: 2023 International Conference on Electrical, Computer and Energy Technologies (ICECET)
Abstract summary: The paper explores the use and requirements of datagram communication and protocols in Asset Administration Shells and Digital Twins.

Title: The Role of Multi-Agents in Digital Twin Implementation: Short Survey
Abstract summary: The paper explores the role of multi-agent systems in implementing digital twins, but does not specifically address research gaps in agent communication protocols for expertise modeling digital twins.

Title: The Paradigm of Digital Twin Communications
Authors: T. Luan, Ruhan Liu, Longxiang Gao, Rui Li, Haibo Zhou
Abstract summary: The paper discusses the communication framework for digital twins, which is an open research issue.

Title: On the Integration of Agents and Digital Twins in Healthcare
Authors: Angelo Croatti, Matteo Gabellini, Sara Montagna, A. Ricci
Abstract summary: The paper discusses the integration of agents and digital twins in healthcare, but does not specifically address research gaps related to agent communication protocols for expertise modeling digital twins.

Title: Towards Fusing Data and Expert Knowledge for Better-Informed Digital Twins: An Initial Framework
Abstract summary: The paper proposes a framework for integrating expert knowledge and data to improve Digital Twin model extraction, identifying challenges and opportunities in this area.

Title: Characterising the Digital Twin: A systematic literature review
Authors: D. Jones, C. Snider, Aydin Nassehi, J. Yon, B. Hicks
Venue: CIRP - Journal of Manufacturing Science and Technology
Abstract summary: This paper identifies research gaps in digital twin characterization, including technical implementations and integration between virtual entities, but does not specifically address agent communication protocols for expertise modeling.

Title: Expert Twin: A Digital Twin with an Integrated Fuzzy-Based Decision-Making Module
Venue: Decision Making: Applications in Management and Engineering
Abstract summary: The paper presents an 'Expert Twin' digital twin framework that integrates fuzzy-based decision-making to enhance manufacturing process optimization and decision support.

Title: An Agent-Directed Digital Twin Framework for Simulation-Based Training
Authors: A. Lektauers, J. Bikovska, Vitālijs Boļšakovs
Venue: International Scientific Conference Information Technology and Management Science Riga Technical University
Abstract summary: The paper presents an agent-directed digital twin framework for simulation-based training, but does not discuss research gaps related to agent communication protocols for expertise modeling digital twin.
